title: About
text: Clinical Trial Watch (TIGIT) is an automated monitoring system designed to track changes in clinical trials related to TIGIT-targeted therapies. By leveraging the ClinicalTrials.gov API v2, this project provides researchers and clinicians with a clear, up-to-date view of the TIGIT landscape.

title: About
text: Clinical Trial Watch (TIGIT) is an automated monitoring system designed to track changes in clinical trials related to TIGIT-targeted therapies. By leveraging the ClinicalTrials.gov API v2, this project provides researchers and clinicians with a clear, up-to-date view of the TIGIT landscape.

title: About
text:
Key Features

Automated Monitoring: Daily updates on the status and key parameters of TIGIT-related clinical trials.
Change Detection: Intelligent diffing engine that highlights meaningful changes in recruitment status, phase, and completion dates.
Data Insights: Interactive visualizations to help understand clinical trial trends and distributions.
Open Data: All consolidated raw data is available for download as a CSV for deeper analysis.

title: About
text:
How it Works

Daily Watch: A GitHub Actions workflow runs every 24 hours to fetch the latest data for all NCT IDs listed in trials.yaml.
Analysis: The src/main.py script compares current data with previous snapshots to identify any changes.
Report Generation: Updates are logged in the history.qmd page, and the dashboard is refreshed with the latest summary stats.
Publishing: The updated Quarto website is automatically published to GitHub Pages.

title: About
text:
Data Source
All data is sourced from ClinicalTrials.gov via their official API.

This project is built using Python, Quarto, and GitHub Actions.
